intro: Chaetachme serrata, commonly known as the serrated chaetachme, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has narrow, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
